channel.title: Loop through char files
channel.description: Well I need something to get reset every week. I have the methods, but I was wondering if there is a specific way i'm supposed to reset an int in all player files? .__.

item.title: Loop through char files
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“ravekitty, post:1, topic:449567”]Well I need something to get reset every week.
I have the methods, but I was wondering if there is a specific way i’m supposed to reset an int in all player files? .__.[/quote]
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/io/File.html

  • take a look at listFiles(FilenameFilter filter)

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/io/BufferedReader.html

  • take a look at readLine()

Read full topic

item.title: Loop through char files
item.dc:creator: @Ryan_Connolly Ryan_Connolly
item.description:
@Ryan_Connolly wrote:

Use a for loop of int’s, then a timer, done.

Read full topic

item.title: Loop through char files
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

yodead:

If your talking about modifing a int in all character files at once. I always used SSR (simple search and replace.) it will modify whatever int your looking for, and turn it into whatever you want. But I am not exactly sure if this is what you wanting, because it is manual.

I’m trying to make it automatic, resetting every sunday.
It’s probably a really simple answer i’m just seeing it as complicated …

Read full topic
